vision: Turn stories into images - Professional AI image generation with advanced prompt engineering for visual storytelling

target_audience.primary: Visual storytellers and content creators who need to generate large batches of consistent AI images for narrative projects (comic artists, storyboard artists, visual novel creators)
secondary: Film pre-visualization teams needing to plan shots and camera angles
Concept artists exploring visual directions quickly
Independent game developers creating character sprites and backgrounds
Educators and children's book illustrators creating consistent characters

phases.name: Foundation & Core Fixes
phases.description: Complete critical infrastructure gaps and improve core reliability for production use

milestones.title: Reference System Complete
milestones.description: Users can reliably save, organize, and reuse reference images across sessions

milestones.title: Prompt Management Live
milestones.description: Users can save, organize, and reuse prompts with folders and search

phases.name: Character & Style Mastery
phases.description: Strengthen the core differentiator of character consistency and expand style management capabilities

milestones.title: Advanced Character Sheets
milestones.description: Users can generate comprehensive character sheets with multiple poses and expressions in one workflow

milestones.title: Style Library System
milestones.description: Users can save, share, and one-click apply style presets with consistent results

phases.name: Workflow & Productivity
phases.description: Enhance batch generation capabilities and streamline professional production workflows

milestones.title: Smart Batch System
milestones.description: Users can queue, prioritize, and manage large batch generations with intelligent scheduling

milestones.title: Export Pipeline Complete
milestones.description: Users can export storyboards in multiple professional formats (PDF, print-ready, video storyboard)

phases.name: Community & Collaboration
phases.description: Build network effects through community features and enable team collaboration

milestones.title: Recipe Marketplace Launch
milestones.description: Users can browse, rate, and purchase community-created recipes and style packs

milestones.title: Team Collaboration
milestones.description: Teams can collaborate on storyboards with real-time updates and role-based permissions

phases.name: AI-Powered Intelligence
phases.description: Leverage AI to automate tedious tasks and provide intelligent creative assistance

milestones.title: Script-to-Storyboard AI
milestones.description: AI can automatically break down scripts into shot suggestions with camera angles and compositions

milestones.title: Creative AI Assistant
milestones.description: AI proactively suggests improvements, continuity fixes, and creative alternatives

phases.name: Platform Expansion
phases.description: Expand to mobile native apps and enterprise features for broader market reach

milestones.title: Mobile Apps Live
milestones.description: Native iOS and Android apps available in app stores with offline capabilities

milestones.title: Enterprise Ready
milestones.description: Enterprise features including SSO, team management, and usage analytics

features.title: Complete Reference Image Persistence to Supabase
features.description: Finish the Supabase integration for reference images so users can reliably save, organize, and access their reference images across sessions and devices. Currently marked as TODO in the codebase.
features.rationale: Reference images are critical for character consistency - the #1 differentiator. Without reliable persistence, users lose their work and the @reference syntax becomes unreliable. This addresses competitor pain points where users struggle with character consistency (Midjourney pain-1-2, DALL-E pain-3-2).
acceptance_criteria: Reference images are uploaded to Supabase Storage on save
Reference images persist across browser sessions
Reference images sync across devices for logged-in users
Reference image URLs are valid and accessible in prompts
Deleted references are cleaned up from storage
user_stories: As a comic artist, I want my character references to persist so that I can continue my project across multiple sessions
As a visual storyteller, I want to access my references from any device so that I can work from my home and office

features.title: User Prompts Organization System
features.description: Implement the user_prompts table and UI for saving, organizing, and reusing prompts. Allow users to create folders, add tags, and quickly search their prompt library.
features.rationale: Power users create hundreds of prompts during a project. Without organization, they waste time recreating prompts or searching through history. This addresses the repetitive prompt work pain point shared across all competitors (pain-1-4, pain-3-4).
acceptance_criteria: Users can save prompts with custom names and descriptions
Users can organize prompts into folders
Users can add tags to prompts for filtering
Quick search finds prompts by name, content, or tags
One-click loads saved prompt into Shot Creator
user_stories: As a storyboard artist, I want to save my best prompts so that I can reuse them for similar scenes
As a comic creator, I want to organize prompts by project so that I can quickly find the right prompt for each series

features.title: Reference Library Autocomplete with Real Counts
features.description: Connect the reference library autocomplete to show actual counts and real-time availability of references. Currently showing placeholder data.
features.rationale: Users need accurate feedback when using @reference syntax. Showing wrong counts or unavailable references breaks the workflow and causes failed generations, wasting credits.
acceptance_criteria: Autocomplete shows real count of available references
Unavailable or deleted references are not shown
Autocomplete updates in real-time as references are added/removed
Performance remains fast with 100+ references
user_stories: As a user, I want to see accurate reference counts so that I know what's available to use
As a creator, I want autocomplete to only show valid references so that my generations don't fail

features.title: Prompt Templates with Variables
features.description: Create a prompt template system that allows users to define reusable prompt structures with placeholder variables like {character}, {action}, {setting} that can be quickly filled in for each generation.
features.rationale: Reduces repetitive prompt writing - a major pain point. Templates with variables enable faster batch creation while maintaining consistency. Competitors lack this capability entirely (pain-1-4, pain-2-4).
acceptance_criteria: Users can create templates with {variable} placeholders
Variables can have default values and descriptions
Applying a template prompts for variable values
Templates can use @references and bracket syntax
Template library is searchable and categorized
user_stories: As a storyboard artist, I want prompt templates so that I can quickly create consistent scene descriptions
As a comic creator, I want to define character action templates so that each panel is described consistently

features.title: Multi-Pose Character Sheet Generator
features.description: Enhance the character sheet feature to generate comprehensive reference sheets with multiple poses, expressions, angles, and outfit variations in a single optimized batch workflow.
features.rationale: Character consistency is THE #1 unsolved problem for narrative creators (gap-1). A robust character sheet generator that creates all needed references upfront eliminates the need for competitors' model training approach (pain-2-1) and solves Midjourney's core weakness (pain-1-2).
acceptance_criteria: Users can select from preset pose libraries (front, side, back, action poses)
Users can select expression sets (neutral, happy, angry, surprised, etc.)
All poses/expressions generate in a single batch with consistency
Generated sheets are automatically tagged and organized as references
One-click creates @reference for entire character sheet
user_stories: As a comic artist, I want to generate a complete character sheet so that I have consistent references for all angles
As a visual novel creator, I want expression sheets so that my characters have consistent emotional variations

features.title: Character Relationship & Group Shots
features.description: Enable defining relationships between characters and generate consistent group shots with multiple characters maintaining their individual consistency.
features.rationale: Narrative projects require multiple characters interacting. Current AI tools struggle with multi-character consistency. This unique feature would be a significant differentiator.
acceptance_criteria: Users can define character relationships (height differences, groupings)
Group shot prompts can include multiple @references
Relative positioning and scaling is maintained
Characters maintain individual consistency in group shots
Relationship presets for common compositions (dialogue, action, crowd)
user_stories: As a comic artist, I want to generate scenes with my hero and villain together so that they look consistent in confrontation panels
As a children's book illustrator, I want group shots of my character family so that they appear consistent together

features.title: Style Presets Library
features.description: Create a comprehensive style preset system where users can save, share, and one-click apply complete style configurations including model settings, style prompts, and reference images.
features.rationale: Maintaining style consistency across a project is a major pain point. Style presets allow users to lock in a visual direction and apply it consistently. This also enables community sharing of popular styles.
acceptance_criteria: Users can save current style settings as a preset
Presets include model, parameters, style prompt, and reference images
One-click applies entire preset to Shot Creator
Presets can be shared publicly or kept private
Built-in starter presets for common styles (comic book, anime, cinematic, etc.)
user_stories: As a visual storyteller, I want to save my project style so that every shot matches my established look
As a concept artist, I want to try community styles so that I can explore different visual directions quickly

features.title: Style Lock for Projects
features.description: Allow users to lock a style for an entire project so that all new generations automatically inherit the locked style settings unless explicitly overridden.
features.rationale: During production, artists need consistency without manually reapplying settings for each generation. Style lock prevents accidental style drift and speeds up workflow.
acceptance_criteria: Users can lock a style preset to a storyboard project
New shots inherit locked style automatically
Visual indicator shows when style is locked
Users can override locked style for specific shots
Unlocking style requires confirmation to prevent accidents
user_stories: As a storyboard artist, I want to lock my project style so that I don't accidentally change it mid-production
As a comic creator, I want consistent style across all panels without manually setting it each time

features.title: Batch Generation Queue Manager
features.description: Create a visual queue management system for batch generations where users can see pending jobs, reorder priorities, pause/resume, and get notifications on completion.
features.rationale: Large storyboard projects may queue 50+ generations. Without queue management, users can't prioritize urgent shots or monitor progress. This directly addresses batch processing pain (pain-1-4, pain-3-4).
acceptance_criteria: Visual queue shows all pending, in-progress, and completed generations
Users can drag to reorder priority
Users can pause/resume queue processing
Browser notifications on batch completion
Queue persists across page refreshes
Clear indicators of estimated completion time
user_stories: As a storyboard artist, I want to see my generation queue so that I know when my priority shots will complete
As a creator, I want to reorder my queue so that I get the most important shots first

features.title: Smart Variation Suggestions
features.description: AI-powered suggestions for prompt variations based on the current prompt and project context. Suggests camera angles, lighting changes, emotional variations, and alternative compositions.
features.rationale: Reduces creative burden and speeds up iteration. Instead of manually writing every variation, users get intelligent suggestions they can accept, modify, or reject.
acceptance_criteria: AI suggests 3-5 variations for current prompt
Suggestions include camera angle changes
Suggestions include lighting/mood variations
One-click adds suggestion to generation queue
Suggestions improve based on user selections over time
user_stories: As a storyboard artist, I want variation suggestions so that I can quickly explore different angles for a scene
As a concept artist, I want AI suggestions so that I discover compositions I wouldn't have thought of

features.title: PDF Storyboard Export
features.description: Export complete storyboards as professionally formatted PDF documents with customizable layouts, shot annotations, dialogue/action notes, and print-ready resolution.
features.rationale: Storyboards need to be shared with teams, clients, and stakeholders. PDF export with professional formatting enables Director's Palette to integrate into real production workflows.
acceptance_criteria: Export storyboard as multi-page PDF
Multiple layout options (grid, single shot per page, presentation)
Include shot numbers, descriptions, and annotations
High-resolution output suitable for printing
Custom branding/watermark options
user_stories: As a film pre-viz artist, I want PDF exports so that I can share storyboards with the director
As a freelance storyboard artist, I want professional PDF output so that I can deliver to clients

features.title: Video Storyboard Export
features.description: Export storyboards as video files with configurable timing per shot, transitions, and optional audio track support for animatic-style presentations.
features.rationale: Film and animation workflows often require animatic versions. Video export bridges the gap between static storyboard and full animation/film, enabling better stakeholder communication.
acceptance_criteria: Export storyboard as MP4 video
Configurable timing per shot
Basic transition options (cut, fade, dissolve)
Optional audio track import
Export resolution options (720p, 1080p, 4K)
user_stories: As a film pre-viz artist, I want video exports so that I can create rough animatics for timing review
As an animation director, I want to add rough audio to my storyboard video so that I can pitch the project

features.title: Print-Ready Comic Panel Export
features.description: Export comic pages with proper bleed, margins, and print-ready specifications for common comic formats (US comic, manga, European album).
features.rationale: Comic artists are a primary target audience. Professional print export eliminates the need for additional software to prepare files for printing, completing the end-to-end workflow.
acceptance_criteria: Export with standard comic page dimensions
Proper bleed and safe area markings
CMYK color space option for print
Multiple page export for full issues
Print-ready PDF with proper embedded fonts
user_stories: As a comic artist, I want print-ready exports so that I can send directly to print-on-demand services
As a manga creator, I want proper manga page dimensions so that my work prints correctly

features.title: Recipe Marketplace with Ratings
features.description: Expand the community recipes feature into a full marketplace where creators can share, rate, review, and optionally sell their recipes, style packs, and character templates.
features.rationale: Community sharing creates network effects that competitors lack. A marketplace incentivizes quality content creation and helps new users get started quickly with proven recipes.
acceptance_criteria: Users can publish recipes to marketplace
Star ratings and written reviews
Download/usage counts displayed
Categories and search/filter
Optional paid recipes with revenue share
Creator profiles with portfolio
user_stories: As a style creator, I want to share my recipes so that others can benefit from my work
As a new user, I want to browse popular recipes so that I can learn best practices quickly

features.title: Style Transfer from Community
features.description: Enable one-click style transfer where users can apply a community creator's style to their own characters while maintaining character consistency.
features.rationale: Discovering a great style is just the start - applying it to existing characters is the challenge. Style transfer bridges community inspiration and personal projects.
acceptance_criteria: Preview style on own characters before applying
Character consistency maintained after style transfer
Adjustable style strength slider
Batch apply to multiple characters
Attribution to original style creator
user_stories: As a visual storyteller, I want to try community styles on my characters so that I can find the perfect look
As a creator, I want to preview styles before committing so that I don't waste credits

features.title: Real-Time Collaborative Storyboard
features.description: Enable multiple users to work on the same storyboard simultaneously with real-time updates, cursor presence, and conflict resolution.
features.rationale: Film and animation teams collaborate on storyboards. Real-time collaboration eliminates version conflicts and enables remote creative sessions, opening up team/studio market segments.
acceptance_criteria: Multiple users can edit same storyboard simultaneously
Cursor presence shows who is working where
Changes sync in real-time across all clients
Conflict resolution for simultaneous edits
Activity feed shows recent changes
Comments and @mentions for discussion
user_stories: As a storyboard supervisor, I want to review and comment while artists work so that we can iterate faster
As a remote team, we want to collaborate on storyboards so that we don't have version conflicts

features.title: Team Workspaces with Roles
features.description: Create team workspace functionality with shared projects, role-based permissions (admin, editor, viewer), and unified billing for studios and teams.
features.rationale: Studios and teams are a key growth market. Team workspaces enable enterprise sales and create stickier accounts with higher lifetime value.
acceptance_criteria: Create and manage team workspaces
Invite members with specific roles
Shared project library within team
Unified credit pool for team
Admin dashboard with usage analytics
SSO integration for enterprise
user_stories: As a studio owner, I want team billing so that I can manage costs across my artists
As a team lead, I want role-based access so that I can control who can edit vs view

features.title: Script-to-Shot AI Breakdown
features.description: AI-powered feature that analyzes a written script or story text and automatically suggests shot breakdowns with scene descriptions, camera angles, and character positioning.
features.rationale: The biggest time sink in storyboarding is translating script to shots. AI automation of this step dramatically accelerates the workflow and addresses the complete storyboard workflow gap (gap-3).
acceptance_criteria: Paste script text and get shot suggestions
AI identifies scenes, characters, and actions
Suggested camera angles for each shot
Suggested compositions and framing
One-click creates storyboard from suggestions
Manual editing/refinement of AI suggestions
user_stories: As a screenwriter, I want to quickly visualize my script so that I can see how scenes will flow
As a director, I want AI shot suggestions so that I can focus on creative decisions rather than technical setup

features.title: Automatic Camera Angle Suggestions
features.description: Based on scene context and narrative beats, AI suggests optimal camera angles, shot types (wide, medium, close-up), and compositions for maximum emotional impact.
features.rationale: Not all users are trained in cinematography. AI guidance helps beginners create more professional storyboards while giving experts a starting point to refine.
acceptance_criteria: AI analyzes scene context and suggests angles
Explains why each angle is suggested (e.g., 'low angle for power')
Multiple options for each scene
Learn from user preferences over time
Educational tooltips about cinematography principles
user_stories: As a beginner, I want camera suggestions so that my storyboards look professional
As a director, I want quick angle options so that I can compare compositions faster

features.title: Continuity Checker
features.description: AI-powered review of storyboard sequences that flags potential continuity issues like character positioning, lighting consistency, and prop placement across shots.
features.rationale: Continuity errors are embarrassing and costly in production. Catching them at the storyboard stage saves significant time and money down the line.
acceptance_criteria: AI analyzes shot sequences for continuity
Flags character position jumps
Flags lighting/time-of-day inconsistencies
Flags missing or appearing props
Provides fix suggestions
Learn from user corrections
user_stories: As a storyboard artist, I want continuity checking so that directors don't find errors in my work
As a film student, I want to learn about continuity so that I improve my skills

features.title: Smart Prompt Enhancement
features.description: AI assistant that reviews prompts and suggests improvements for better results - adding missing details, fixing common issues, and optimizing for the selected model.
features.rationale: Prompt engineering is a skill barrier. AI assistance helps users get better results without deep prompt knowledge, reducing frustration and credit waste on poor generations.
acceptance_criteria: Analyze prompt and suggest improvements
Explain what each suggestion improves
Model-specific optimizations
One-click apply suggestions
Track which suggestions lead to better results
user_stories: As a beginner, I want prompt suggestions so that I get better results without deep knowledge
As an experienced user, I want quick optimizations so that I don't miss obvious improvements

features.title: Native Mobile Apps (iOS & Android)
features.description: Complete the Capacitor mobile app development and release native iOS and Android apps to the App Store and Play Store with full feature parity and offline capabilities.
features.rationale: Mobile app extends reach and enables on-the-go creativity. Currently Capacitor is configured but not fully released. Mobile apps also command higher perceived value.
acceptance_criteria: iOS app in App Store
Android app in Play Store
Offline viewing of generated images
Camera integration for reference photos
Push notifications for generation completion
Biometric authentication
user_stories: As a creator on the go, I want a mobile app so that I can review storyboards and queue generations
As a location scout, I want to take reference photos directly into the app so that I can use them immediately

features.title: Enterprise SSO & Admin Dashboard
features.description: Enterprise features including Single Sign-On (SAML/OIDC), centralized admin dashboard, usage analytics, and compliance controls for studio/enterprise customers.
features.rationale: Enterprise market represents significant revenue opportunity. SSO is often a requirement for studio IT departments, and admin controls are needed for managing large teams.
acceptance_criteria: SAML 2.0 and OIDC SSO support
Admin dashboard with usage analytics
User provisioning via SCIM
Audit logs for compliance
Custom data retention policies
Dedicated support channel
user_stories: As an IT admin, I want SSO so that I can manage access through our identity provider
As a studio manager, I want usage analytics so that I can optimize our creative pipeline

features.title: API Access for Developers
features.description: Provide a public API that allows developers and power users to integrate Director's Palette generation capabilities into their own tools and workflows.
features.rationale: API access enables custom integrations, automation, and expands the platform's reach. This addresses a Midjourney weakness (pain-1-5) and attracts technical power users.
acceptance_criteria: RESTful API with authentication
Endpoints for image generation, reference management, project management
Rate limiting and usage quotas
Webhooks for generation completion
API documentation and SDK
Usage dashboard for API consumers
user_stories: As a developer, I want API access so that I can build custom integrations with my creative tools
As a studio, I want to automate storyboard generation so that we can integrate with our production pipeline
